ai.summary: Berneray Circular Walk is a 15.3 km loop in the UK that tests stamina with a hard rating, combining coastal paths, grassy tracks, and uneven terrain. The route rewards with rugged sea views and expansive open moorland, but can be exposed to wind and changing weather.
ai.terrain_summary: A coastal-to-rural loop featuring coastal paths, grassy tracks, and uneven or rocky sections. Expect exposed ground in places, potential boggy patches, and occasional stone steps. Tidal influences may affect some coastal segments and footing can be slippery when wet.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, hard hike with variable terrain and weather. Wear sturdy footwear and appropriate layered clothing. Check tide times and weather forecasts before starting; some parts near the coast can be hazardous at high tide or in storms. Carry a map and compass or GPS, bring sufficient water and high-energy food, and inform someone of your plans. Mobile reception may be limited in remote sections. Stay on marked paths and be prepared for sudden weather changes and strong winds.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Head torch (in case of delays) or extra batteries
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn; weather can be windy and changeable year-round, so plan for cool coastal conditions and potential rain.
